concept.definition:
[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
X-ray attenuation of the mass is greater than the expected attenuation of an equal volume offibroglandular breast tissue.

[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
(historically, "isodense")X-ray attenuation of the mass is the same as the expected attenuation of an equal volume offibroglandular breast tissue.

[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
X-ray attenuation of the mass is less than the expected attenuation of an equal volume offibroglandular breast tissue. A low density mass may be a group of microcysts. If such a findingis identified at mammography, it may very well not be malignant but appropriately maybe worked up.

[Bi-Rads® Atlas — Mammography Fifth Ed. 2013]
This includes all masses containing fat, such as oil cyst, lipoma or galactocele, as well as mixeddensity masses such as hamartoma. A fat-containing mass will almost always represent abenign mass.
